QuestionName: Which of these is NOT a power of vampires? (in the Buffy-verse)
Lesson:
Claiming is a trope that arose in Buffy the Vampire Slayer fandom, and in that fandom it refers to the vampiric version of mating for life.
This process often involves a vampire biting but not killing, and/or sharing blood with a human. It sometimes involves ritual words spoken by the vampire making the claim.

QuestionName: Which of these Slayers did NOT die before the collapse of the Hellmouth in 2003?
Lesson: Spike killed Nikki Wood in the 1970s, Drusilla killed Kendra in 1998, and Buffy Summers died (and was resurrected) twice; once in 1997, and once in 2001.

QuestionName: Pick the change that does NOT happen when a vampire shifts into ”Game Face”:
Lesson: While vampires never have to breathe, they can, and so they don't have to stop when they shift.

QuestionName: Pick the option that will definitively kill a vampire:
Lesson: Starvation will turn a vampire feral, but won't kill them. Exposure to garlic and holy water can ward vampires off, but old vampires can build up a tolerance. The only sure-fire way to kill a vampire are beheading, immolation, and a stake through the heart.

QuestionName: Which of these facts about Dracula is false?
1: Dracula is one of the Old Ones
2: He can shapeshift into a swarm of bees
3: If Dracula were ever staked, he would seemingly die as he turned to dust, but only before appearing as a cloud of mist and reconstituting himself
4: Dracula is instead  able to sense when lightning is about to strike
Lesson: In the comics, Dracula was briefly transformed into Maloker, the powerful Old One who created the first vampire, whose essence lived on. However, he himself was never one of the Old Ones.
